Dear MPS Community,

We are hosting a come & go reception to honor longtime superintendent secretary, Martha Buttram. She is the glue to central office and has done well to keep the districts superintendents in-line. We are going to miss Martha but wish her and her husband, Jim the best as they move to Texas to be close to their children and grandchildren.

Please take a few minutes on Friday, November 1st to come by and thank Martha for her many years of service to MPS and wish her well on her next adventure!

Thank You,
Jeremy Hogan
Superintendent
Miami Public Schools

This is demonstrated well in The Wardog Way, Episode 9 - Creativity.

Dear MPS Family,

I am writing to let you know that we are still enrolling students in our Pre-K3 (Wee Little Wardogs), Pre-K, and Kindergarten programs. There is a fee for students to attend the Wee Little Wardog program, and you can contact the MPS central office for more information at (918) 542-8455. Also, if you have or know anyone who has a child who will be 4 or 5 years of age before Septemeber 1st, they can enroll in our Pre-K or Kindergarten programs. You can get an enrollment packet at the MPS Central Ofice at 26 N Main Street on Monday-Thursday from 8:30 AM to 3:30 PM.

Please help spread the word about these programs!

Thank You, Mr. Hogan

Dear MPS Family,

I am writing to let you know that summer programs have been extended since flooding caused us to miss some time.

Summer Food Program - The summer food service program hosted at Nichols Upper ES will continue until Friday, June 7th. Breakfast is served from 8:00-8:30 and lunch is served from 11:30-12:15. There are no income or registration requirements, and meals are provided to any child age 18 and under.

GOALS - The summer GOALS program has also been extended to Friday, June 7th.

Summer Reading Academy - The summer reading academy has been extended to Wednesday, June 5th.

MHS Summer School - summer school has been extended to June 21st.

Thank you for your continued support of MPS as we strive to meet the needs of our students!

Sincerely, Mr. Hogan

[Update 1:30 am 5/22/19]

A significant update has been made to the severe weather potential for today.

Moisture will surge back north today, with thunderstorms likely developing from central in northeast Oklahoma by late afternoon. Atmospheric conditions will be favorable for large hail, damaging winds and possibly a few tornadoes into the evening hours.

Additional flooding can be expected, given the extreme rainfall over the past 24-36 hours across northeast Oklahoma.
